address.streetAddress:
1 Chiltern Street
London W1U 7PA
United Kingdom

review.author: Chloe S.
review.description:
Yummers all around, but be prepared to shell out the pounds. Wonderful creative food, exquisite service, but totally unpretentious. For starters, the Caesar salad is a must and the Beef Tartar unique (do I detect liver? Foie Gras?). The night we went, the oyster selection was Irish and both kinds were just sooooo good; I could eat dozens of these, but tonight was not an oyster night.
For mains we had the Staffordshire beef fillet, Iberian pork and Tandoori Monkfish. See picture - each perfectly cooked.
Had such a fun waiter, and all the staff were spunky and gracious. Just had a very good time; getting a resy here isn't the easiest, but worth it!

review.author: Dixie O.
review.description:
Chiltern. 
Chiltern. 
Chiltern. 
From the crab donuts
To the perfectly crispy and slippery octopus tentacles 
To the McDonalds-esque french fries
Burning up the house with the beautiful burrata 
Sliding into the perfectly prepared pork DM's 
Peaking with the chocolate sourdough mixture from heaven
Chiltern is our #1
Chiltern is the winner
Chiltern over everything
Kiki truly loves Chiltern 
YEET
Thank you & we will absolutely be coming again
 
10 Stars

review.author: Sin F.
review.description:
Lives up to the elegant hype because I traveled from San Francisco, California and stayed at the hotel for several days in April 2018, enjoying the tasty, well-prepared food immensely and received 5-star service at all times. Chiltern Firehouse is one of a kind due to hands-on management.
***Continue for personal highlights.***
Dizzy from jet lag and unpacking in my cute room on the 3rd floor the enthusiastic & elegant staff accommodated my late lunch holding a corner table alas, unsuitable for people watching. They prepared a new table for me and their suave staff's baroque politeness was beautifully theatrical as I absorbed the London vibe, fantastic.
First meal was fish, some veggies a salad? Was jet lagged as hell & siped champagne for restorative purposes (hee hee) when I spied the super duper famous  ____, cheers.  I'd say more about that but what happens at the Chiltren Firehouse stays there. 
Being a girl who lives near Twitter's headquarters I appreciate their no selfies standard, bravo. You're not in American there, hooray.
During my stay at the hotel, a London native pal and I ate at the bar &  shared a bottle of bubbly, fries, those delectable crab donuts the fried chicken thingies their bar food is an American dream:  Euro-size portions at posh-American prices, wink, cool, I kept my figure didn't gain any weight on vacation. Seriously.
 I ordered room service several times and it was better than most San Francisco restaurants. Worth every considerable penny paid. Their green juice and French press coffee is amazing.
My well-appointed room with the automatic authentic fireplace and an old-school rotary phone was very quiet one of the best I've stayed in.
Chiltern Firehouse is a Benetton ad come to life with pretty smiling happy elegant as hell employees, do they breed them? Am I rambling? Yes, as I flew 10,000 miles round trip to stay & eat there especially as a warm up to see the Tina Turner musical (swoon) and meet Ruby Wax  (humblebrag but damn, Tina Turner and an Andre Balazs joint?).
5 Stars. Money very well spent for this American chick!

review.author: Joey T.
review.description: Definitely make a reservation before coming, visited the restaurant on a Wednesday afternoon and the restaurant was packed! The food was good (loved the presentation especially), but not amazing - many dishes had potential but I find them quite bland. I tried the much hyped crab doughnuts and was disappointed, couldn't taste the crab at all! I recommend the trout ceviche, steak salad and raspberry pavlova, these were my favorites out of all the other dishes.

review.author: Solah H.
review.description:
Chiltern Firehouse is one of my favorite places in London. It's not exaggerating to say that I just want to fly back for Chiltern Firehouse. The restaurant or hotel renovated out of a firehouse has very cozy atmosphere but also imbues luxurious feelings that make me feel special to be around. 
I have visited for the dinner once and the breakfast; both were pleasant experiences.
You won't be disappointed with this spot.

review.author: Fa R.
review.description:
Very beautiful place. Nice building (amazing architecture), beautiful terrasse and a lovely bar. 
They say many artists/celebrities hang out here. We can easily tell why.
Staff was very nice and smiley but so slow! We waited 20 minutes and nobody came to see us, we had to ask for the menus at the bar. Then, another 15 minutes to get our drinks. We were not sitting at the bar but beside the fireplace. 
Many people go there to see and be seen. 
Quite pricey but you expect it here. 
18£ for a cocktail

review.author: Namsaran K.
review.description: One of the best resturants I ate at while visiting London.  Cute, clean, great service and everything I had was delicious! If you live in London or are just visiting I highly recommend you try this restaurant. Make sure you make a reservation in advance!

review.author: Miko B.
Jahanbi R.
review.description:
A good experience! I went there on a Sunday with friends for a brunch. It was crowded, I think because it was a Sunday. Even when we were on time, we were told to wait at the bar for the table. I ordered a Bloody Mary which was really good. I haven't had such a tasty Blood Mary in ages. Almost more than 30 minutes, when we asked whether the table was ready, we were told that it was ready but the waitress couldn't find us. Weird! 
We ordered few starters and oysters. The starters came on time and then we were served the mains. The Cornish crab omelette is a must try! When my friend enquired about the Oyesters, the waitress said that she had totally forgotten to serve it. So she will bring it after the mains. Again weird!
The chef himself brought the Oyesters to the table and explained us about the Oyesters, which was very kind of him. They were pretty good.
Overall a good experience with food. The service is not efficient.

review.author: Sophia T.
review.description: The ambiance was nice with long-wicked candles on the tables & dim lighting. Our party of 5 had a reservation but still had to wait at the bar for a little before being seated, which was fine since it gave us an opportunity to talk to the bartender & decide on drinks. The drinks were very fresh & I was happy with my choice. Our waiter was funny and informative of the dishes & we enjoyed very fresh oysters to start. The plates are small but tasty.

review.author: KW L.
review.description: Wonderful venue for meeting friends, taking in a late breakfast, and enjoying your favorite drink(s). Great staff. Great food. Great drinks. Spectacular.

review.author: Alexa R.
review.description: We had a lovely last evening in London at the Chiltern Firehouse. The menu was imaginative - we enjoyed the burrata, gnocchi and lamb dishes. The atmosphere is upscale, but relaxed and the wait staff was friendly and accommodating. It wasn't a surprise that on a Monday night, every table was full. Yoghurt and sourdough ice creams were a treat! We will definitely be back on our next trip.

review.author: Chef Earth E.
review.description:
2 stars for ambience.
0 stars for food.
Crab stuffed donuts l, first were NOT donuts more like hard bun.  Crab nonexistent ~ lots of egg to cover fact no crab!! Way too much mayonnaise.  Do not order these.
Tempura Aubergine was tasteless served cold, and sauce was "supposed" to be miso.  Did not taste a drop of miso.  Very bland sauce.
Chargrilled Padron Peppers, were NOT chargrilled, hot, tasty.  No salt, a whispering of ricotta salata did not give any additional flavor.  They needed Maldon salt, but cold and watery they were.  Very disappointed in food.
Burger quality was poor, overcooked tough meat. Fries were warm, but tasted perhaps frozen from restaurant supply??? 
Just mediocre foods  at best.
Then to make matters worse a bearded bartender was extremely rude to me when i was taking a photo of bar, which was empty!! He said "you can not take photos!  Such a stern rude voice, and i did not understand, so he repeated quite rudely again.  So he then says hotel policy, i relied i understand.  But why was i treated like this.  How was i to know?  No signs, no clue... so perhaps the next time he interacts with guests like this perhaps a softer voice, a nicer approach and not such a horrible glare.  I almost left.   In a way i should of considering the food and rude bartender.  Waitress was adorable sweet, soft and kind mannerism.

review.author: Jenny C.
review.description: Do not support this business in any way. Terrible customer service and hospitality.  They must hate Americans in general. Extremely disappointed in my visit here. After a very large and generous 6 person meal...we went to meet friends in their bar. The bar was very empty and they did not allow us to stay nor have a conversation with our friends there for more than 60 seconds before they escorted us out to a back alley and treated us like trash.  Employees need to be re-evaluated and have an extreme superiority complex.  Boycott at all costs.

review.author: Alicia Y.
review.description:
Lovely & upscale restaurant. Suitable for special occasions - lunch, brunch and dinner avsilable. It is a pretty fancy place to dine and there is a dress code - No trainers or flip flops! Casual smart is fine. People who show up there can be quite dressy. If you are lucky,  you might run into a celebrity :) Unfortunately I've never had the chance to bump into any local movie stars during my visits. Bummer!!
I had dinner on my first visit and it was on weekday with a group of 3pax. It was hard to get a booking, and you might want to do this in advance especially if it's near a festive season. We tried to increase our group size to 4pax at the very last minute over the phone but were politely rejected. So don't just show up with a +1 at the door, you might not even get your table. 
Upon arrival they ushered me to the table and took my coats and jackets. Immediately sat me down and made me comfy. Then proceeded to recommend me a cocktail which would pair well with our food. I enjoyed my first experience so much that I decided to make a second comeback with my partner for a Christmas brunch over the weekend. It took me about a good month in advance to book a slot, dinner slots were completely wiped out till 2017. 
I must say I was a little disappointed with their service the second time around. I did not receive the same hospitality as I did for dinner. The staff seem a little flustered that day, nothing was really offered nor recommended to us. It felt like that they were a little short handed. What a shame though, I was hoping to give my partner the same level of experience I had the first time but it wasn't up to that level. Nevertheless the food and drinks were still amazing. However it would be great if they maintain consistency with their services.

review.author: Morgan R.
review.description:
I was SO EXCITED to eat here, I've been wanting to come for a while but never had the time. This place 100% met my expectations. 
The entrance is very confusing but normally they have workers to lead you to the restaurant from the entrance. The venue is also a hotel, so there are many hallways to walk down. The restaurant is bright and open and has a distinctive smoky smell. 
I was extremely excited to try their pancakes. THEY WERE DELICIOUS!!!! The pancakes are thick and fluffy and taste like thick American pancakes. The blueberries, blueberry compote, syrup, and yogurt topping all come on the side so you can add what you would like to. I highly recommend getting the pancakes. 
The pastries are also lovely. My mother got the croissants and loved them, but they are very large so next time, it might be better to get the selection of miniature pastries instead. 
The orders of toast are rather small so one order is only enough for one person, but it is sourdough toast and is amazing!
They also have several delicious juices. The fresh pressed apple juice was amazing.  Additionally, they have drip coffee that is pretty good.

review.author: Roxana Q.
review.description:
Fun, posh vibe!
I made a reservation for my birthday brunch here & i'm so glad i did!  What a fun experience.
I called about a month in advance and had no issues getting a reservation for the day & time i wanted. I know this place is notoriously difficult to get into but maybe that is just for dinner?  I was apprehensive about it but ended up having no issues.
We ordered several items - ricotta blueberry pancakes, cornbread, chili crab noodles,  crab beignets & cesar salad.
The chili crab noodles were to die for! I'm so sad i didn't ask more questions about them so i could try to recreate them at home.
The cesar salad was also quite memorable. 
Overall, all the food was great and a fun place to celebrate a special occasion or a night out.
Will definitely be back on my next trip to London!

review.author: Mohammed A.
review.description: nice place nice food good stuff , good portions , cosy warm atmosphere highly recommended for breakfast

review.author: Meghan A.
review.description:
I loved this place. My husband and I had dinner here on a sunny Wednesday night, and it was super buzzy and fun. I had made a reservation via email over a month in advance, and they could only accommodate us at 6pm or 10pm (gah), or at 8pm at chef's counter. I love counter seating, so this worked out perfectly.
The decor was impeccably chic as expected, based on other Andre Balazs joints (Chateau Marmont, The Mercer). The food and service, however, were world class as well. The ever-changing menu really focused on seasonal ingredients, so we took advantage of that.
We started with the asparagus, which was appropriately light despite the mountain of egg yolk shavings that adorned it. For a main, I went with the gnocchi, which was accompanied by a flawless presentation of taleggio, raisins, spring peas, and rounds of fennel. It was spring on a plate, and I am still thinking about it 2 weeks later.

review.author: Stephanie C.
review.description:
An old fire station, chiltern is trendy and cute. We went for drinks with friends around 6:30 pm. There were 7 of us and we sat in the corner by the record player.
Drinks are good with plenty of options for cocktails, beer, and wine. There is a bar menu for food, which includes cheese plate, charcuterie, burger, etc.
Great place for drinks!

address.streetAddress:
1 Chiltern Street
London W1U 7PA
United Kingdom

review.author: Janine R.
review.description: This is a bustling restaurant in an old firehouse. It is lovely and vibrant.  I had the pain AI chocolat and it wonderfully flaky with high quality chocolate within. My companions had the pancakes with syrup and berries and greatly enjoyed them as well.

review.author: Jennifer L.
review.description:
I was really disappointed by this place but the food was really tasty so Im putting a 3. 
The service was hazy not to the standard you would expect from such a place!
However the food was really tasty and original.
We had the seared steak salad, the pancakes, the crab doughnuts (loved those), Syrian tartare (very original with the yoghurt and pistaccio), the foie gras and the smoked mackerel.
The Spritz cocktails although not appealing looking were super good!

review.author: Kiki H.
review.description: This was probably the most disappointing (and expensive) meal of our trip. While service and the atmosphere were great, the food was just so-so. They were out of the burrata appetizer, which was a bummer. The grilled octopus was just ok as was the mushroom/egg appetizer. My chicken was weird tasting and my husbands lamb was Ok. Everything was super small. I did enjoy the tarte tatin for dessert. I wouldn't come back.

review.author: Blake A.
review.description:
First trip to London and on a whim me and 3 friends came to dinner here for my birthday. Everything started off amazing. Food was great, service was spot on and atmosphere was really fun. Met some cool people sitting next to us and decided to get the check and go to the bar in the hotel attached,also apart of chiltern firehouse. This is where the whole night took a wild turn. 
After we got in ,the hostess, Amy Cuff, came up and notified us we would only be allowed one drink and would need to leave immediately after because the bar was "private" and since the hotel was packed they "needed the room" for hotel guests. Which we were with. 
Just FYI. The bar was empty....
We tried to order another dink from the EMPTY bar and the bartender said very apologetically the hostess notified him we were allowed one drink and then require to leave. 
Birthday ruined. Never coming back. Ladder Shed London. You failed.

review.author: Richard M.
review.description:
A solid four. This place has a nice vibe and the food is Delish. Loved the specials, the crab donuts were tasty but simple won tonight - great quality fresh natural oysters. Yummo. 
I can't help but feel like I'll always unfairly compare chiltern to viajante... viajante is hands down the winner but still very good.

review.author: Smokie H.
review.description: Outstanding cocktails & food, cool space but loud atmosphere (place to be seen and apparently also heard). Three stars due to horrifically snooty incompetent hostesses (yes, plural).. The outdoor area was fairly empty but hostesses insisted on seating us in a walkway. We finally ended up with a decent table thanks to our server and persistence from my husband.  Service was good but slow. Started with super stiff excellent drinks -- gin & tonic and old fashioned. Had to have second each despite generous pour. Then shared spiced watermelon, steak tartare & Iberian bbq pork. Could have order seconds on all but instead tried four desserts, all fab. Would we come again?  Not sure unless with a regular to get decent table. We had reserved but clearly counts for nought.

review.author: Tricky R.
review.description:
My friend and I went the other night 
I doubt we will be returning
Here is the experience beginning to end
Chiltern fireplace has always had a buzz about it attracted a nice crowd  and good food and drinks
I looked up the restaurants website on google hit call a posh sounding woman answered , I communicated that I wanted to book and she asked me to hold for a minute. 12 minutes later she said she could offer me a table at 8:30 in response to an 8 pm request  I accepted ( this was a month in advance for a Sunday night)
I confirmed the booking the day before by email no probs
On the day my friend was delayed by heavy traffic 
So I called and asked if it would be ok if we were 15 minutes late the woman who answered said "that should be ok I will note the booking" I wasn't sure where I stood but just assumed all would be ok.
We arrived 10 minutes late staff were cheery polite and receptive and showed us to a nice table
We both ordered salads a rib eye on bone steak to share a bottle of 2012 tignanello  420 pounds
Cesar salad nicely presented tasty but hard to eat as dish was a bit small ( fell over sides when you tried to eat it) steak was excellent and perfect one of the best I have ever had it was shared but when it came waiter hadn't cleared starter plates and tried to have us eat it on salad plates 
No bread served until requested (over 45 minutes)
I ordered chocolate desert bland too tart tasteless and texture less 
Sommelier was all show and no go  acted  trendy snooty etc but didn't know his game  served wine way to cold 17 degrees c good wine (240£)
Needs to be served at room temperature when challenged he was a bit disrespectful
When we were leaving we attempted to have a drink at the bar we were polite we were refused  I asked for the nice hostess who met us upon arrival and was told that she was doing her evening management report . instead  we were lead down a dark coloured passage to an alleyway  behind the restaurant where a nice burley guy managed to find us a cab after a 10 minute wait while we were waiting another "uncool "couple met the same fate
This was the second time this has happened on a quiet Sunday night I can't help but feel like I was trying to gain admission to studio 54 in the 80's
So here is my message to management : be careful this restaurant/hotel has been going for a while and is starting to come off the boil a bit Staff in general are well trained and polite there seems to be an over abundance of peacocky Italian types that are more show than go and a smidge arrogant 420 pounds is a lot for a steak and a bottle of Italian wine not everyone can pay that effortlessly  rather than let a pair of nice well dressed polite older guys have one drink after dinner  to choose to lead them down the basement tunnel of rejection is a bit off putting and demoralising and takes the edge off what would have otherwise been a fun evening
Getting too cool for school ...... maybe management is considering selling the place and is trying to hang on a little bit too long to the exclusive celebrity hype image . I don't know but if I am not good enough to have a drink at the bar I am not going to buy fine wine and posh chow in the restaurant
All the best for the future

review.author: Victoria P.
review.description: Came to Chiltern Firehouse based off common knowledge that this was a London hotspot.  I was dining alone on vacation and informed them to offer me a spot at the bar or whatever they had a available.  I was able to sit at the chefs counter and get a full on show of them cooking everyones food.  I have to say the place inside and out was gorgeous and the service was great.  Yes, it's a bit pricey and that's why I have given 4 stars because I'm not sure if the food equals out to the hefty tag.  The food looks delicious and is prepared in detail but my salmon was a little too firm, as was the roe on it and the crab donuts were good but not spectacular.  I also had a chocolate cake which was delicious.  Overall great experience to check off the London bucket list but not sure I would immediately rush back next time I'm in town.

review.author: Lacey C.
review.description: Love the atmosphere, the drinks, and even more, the oysters. Amazing time with friends.

review.author: Elizabeth L.
review.description: Hello handsome! Gorgeous brunch in a garden setting, elegant. Each area of the Firehouse is beautifully done - from the outdoor garden, semi-alfresco tall-ceilinged bar room, to the main dining room. Enjoyed an outstanding smoked salmon eggs benedict while friends loved the fluffy pancakes with fresh blueberries and crème fraîche. There is a bit of celebrity hype around the Firehouse, but regardless, quite a fine establishment.

review.author: Claude S.
review.description:
Bland.  Bland, bland, bland.  
I visit family in London once a year.  This year my splurge was to go to Chiltern Firehouse.  It's a beautiful space with excellent staff and excellent wine selection.  The food presentation is exquisite.  And the food is... meh.  
-mini-doughnuts stuffed with crab meat -- the doughnut was tasteless,
-chard octopus had potential, even simply done with lemon it can be fantastic, but this preparation with a little pickled radish and a little chorizo was underwhelming, 
-the salmon was presented beautifully and it was fine but hardly worth a return trip.  
The best part of the meal was excellent brown bread with fantastic creamy, creamy butter.

review.author: Hansen O.
review.description:
Went here for lunch on a weekday afternoon and sat outside on the patio. Loved the ambiance of the area. The food was also quite good, if not a little overpriced. I ordered the sea bass, and had a good crab donut starter.
However, the service I have to say was one of the worst I've received at a restaurant. I don't know if it was the way we were dressed (didn't dress too formally, it was lunchtime) or something else, but the waitress was rude and not friendly at all. It's a shame as the environment is so beautiful. If you're going to be paying £30 for a single dish, the service better be up to par! Won't be returning.

review.author: Yui I.
review.description:
The hype was real, its Nuno Mendes at its best with no frills. Despite his Michelin background the ambience is relaxed and there's a open kitchen to see all the busy chefs at work. Staff are a little inattentive at times but all friendly. 
The 'snacks' are a must with its famous crab doughnut, we also had the tuna devilled egg, corn bread with bacon and maple syrup butter. For mains we got a mixture but I went for my favourite octopus with daikon/shitake in soy broth. This was Devine with a twist of Japanese flavours. My friends ordered the iberico pork and duck with caramelised carrots and smoked short ribs all looked amazing! We didn't stop there either and indulged in the desserts from strawberry eaton mess, peach melba and rye with old fashioned syrup and vanilla ice cream. We were absolutely stuffed and the bill came to about £70 per person but it was all so worth it!

review.author: Brittany Z. M.
review.description:
I can't say enough amazing things about this place. The food was great and creative, the drinks were tasty, the staff were so charming and helpful and checked on us often, including the manager Sam (promote that man. He's a gem) and we felt like superstars! (Even though we're clearly not).  
I was so pleased because I went through a bit to contact and book this place from the states a month before I came just to be sure our group would have a spot.  
I'll post pics if I still have them. If your experience is anything like mine, you won't be disappointed. 
Side note: was kind of hard finding the taxi after we left due to the paparazzi, but the rest of the evening was so amazing who cares!?

review.author: Evan T.
review.description:
This place is fun! It's in a super hip neighborhood and the space reflects that, but it still feels warm and inviting. We had a great waitress who didn't make us feel rushed at all throughout our meal, and we had a great time with the menu. It's definitely a place that is "see and be seen" so it can come off as a bit showy, which I can understand would make some people feel uncomfortable, but to us, it was all in good fun. It's a great place for people watching!
The three of us ordered the fish dishes, which were divine. We had a really great bottle of wine and the sashimi appetizer as well. The service was great -- our candle blew out halfway through the meal and instead of ignoring it they brought us a brand new one! (It may seem silly, but it's the small things that set service apart for me.) 
I liked this place a lot for a fun trendy night out in London.

review.author: Anwar F.
review.description:
The place brought  childhood  memories,I used to live at this street  and I used see the fire  brigates  as something big and amaizing. 
And it used to make noise as they get out of the building to save lives.
I never imagen that it will be Ahotel and fancy  restaurant. 
The sarvice   and the staff were amazing, they offer me a nice table after telling  them  I can't site  on the high  chair  of the bar.
The food was excellent  the only thing is its over priced I think !

review.author: Rachel R.
review.description:
We also had to rely on the AmEx Concierge to get a reservation... though this place has been popular with celebrities for years, it doesn't seem to be waning.  (And we did spot a few older, obscure British tv personalities there.)
Service was great, food was fantastic, and though its not a cheap spot, I thought prices were pretty fair given the quality of the experience. (Just be careful about which wine you order - they have an impressive and expensive list.)
There are several vegetarian options in all sections of the menu.  As others have mentioned, the polenta with truffles was outstanding.  We started with some "carrot blunts", which were smokey and delicious and crispy and fun.  My friends had the pork, which they refused to share because it was so good, and others at the table were very happy with the beef.
Though they are serious about making sure you don't linger at the table more than 2 hours, our waitress secured us seats in the bar so we could finish our espresso martinis there. All in all, it was great food with great vibe - it didn't disappoint!

review.author: Bob K.
review.description:
This place has a reputation for being the place to see and be seen, but while the environment was "active", it seemed overall fine and not overly pretentious.  Really nice European classic environment with a fun bar, great multi-level seating and some unique spaces.  Really nice.  Also seemed to have a front patio that would be a great place to eat (weird that nobody was out there after about 7PM).
We had a private party (in a nice, if snug, dining room at the front of the restaurant) and the food and the service were really amazing.
While we didn't order, per se, we were delighted with an assortment of courses from across the menu...
Bacon Cornbread:  Um, delicious.
Cauliflower Florets:  Seriously savory.  Really great.
Crab-stuffed Donuts:  Not the best...  seemed to struggle to go together.
Fried Chicken:  Seriously amazing.  Really, the best bite we had all night.
We thought we were near done at this point, but way more to come:
Firehouse Caesar:  Yay anchovies!!
Steak Tartare: Mix it up first, then eat.  Great flavors.  So rich.  Wow.
Mullet or Cod Crudo (can't remember which):  Light and flavorful
Gnocchi:  
...and the mains:
Monkfish:  We were getting late in the meal and had a lot of this.  Really amazing.
Lamb (I think it was the lamb...):  Decent, but not amazing.  Obviously forgetful.
I have a huge pet peeve about restaurants serving a very limited set menu for larger parties, so great that these guys gave us a really comprehensive and varied tour around their menu.  Much appreciated.
One critique is that the whole thing could have been salted a bit more.  Other than that, really a perfect meal.  Kudos to this place for not letting food quality slip given the reputation.

review.author: Kyle C.
review.description:
Over the three and a half months that I was in London, this was easily my favorite dining experience. 
I'm told that the Firehouse is a rather upscale place where the big shots of London society (and occasionally celebrities) come to dine. The interior is beautiful, with an heir of classic French brasserie but with a contemporary London twist. Reservations are a must considering the hefty crowd during peak hours. The service was top notch from start to finish, and our server was very knowledgable on the menu and helped us on deciding what to order. We had the cornbread appetizer as well as a salad to start, both delicious. The short rib entree was wonderful and beautifully cooked. My favorite thing on the menu however was the black truffle polenta, very unique and sinful. Dessert consisted of some sort of cake with an ice cream that was also very good. I thoroughly enjoyed the Firehouse; everything from the food, to the service, to the ambience was just fabulous. Definitely one of the highlights of my trip to London.

review.author: Sofia L.
review.description: You absolutely MUST eat here, not just for the food (which is amazing!!) but for the experience. The former firehouse is beautifully decorated. The food and service are top, I have never been for dinner but their brunch is my favourite in London. The pancakes and eggs benedict are a must. Mimosa was mediocre.  Make sure to look out for celebrities!

address.streetAddress:
1 Chiltern Street
London W1U 7PA
United Kingdom

review.author: Alessandra O.
review.description: Best breakfast ever - a very delicious French toast, omelette and cappuccino. I love the atmosphere with the firehoses woven into the ceiling and the beautiful bar area. The decor is very tasteful and the place to go if you're visiting London.

review.author: R g.
review.description: Space is beautiful and staff is very friendly but kind of a weird experience...pancakes are served "barely warm" as opposed to hot, though the flavor is delicious. Had to ask for water when other patrons were offered. Service seemed to be all over the place.

review.author: Adam L.
review.description:
Amazing. Yeah, that good. Gorgeous building, cozy & warm interiors, & warm & professional staff. Nice buzz, but not too noisy. We had an excellent table, thanks to AMEX Concierge.
Food? Uh huh, yeah. Foue gras w/ bacon & fig jam: GTFO. Braised oxtail: Seriously GTFO. Grilled asparagus: dang! And whatever that amazing chocolate concoction pie was: kill me again with chocolate.
Our waiters were amazing, personable, and very professional. Wine list was terrific! 
The reason for only 4 stars? We had to wait for 15 mins for our table at the bar, but there aren't enough bar tables & the area was small. So we kept getting bumped into or (nicely) asked to move a bit, as staff went back & forth. Also, the fries were limp. No excuse.

review.author: Kim N.
review.description:
It's sad that i wont get to eat at Viajante ever again. I was told that Nuno Mendes had moved here with a new concept. My last trip through the UK and it's my first meal in town after a long ass flight. My hotel isnt ready so i get on the tube and lo and behold the station i need is closed. Ive got a large backpack and jacket and as i exit the next station to circle back and then walk a few K its getting hot. Of all the times in London for this to happen..
I walk to the streets and finally get there. Im shown to a space that is looking right at the pass. Perfect. Ive been up for 20 hours and can finally settle. It turns out my server is an ex Dinex guy and worked for Daniel and his mix of restos in NYC. Good start. Im watching as they furiously plate and cook, and expedite. This is a furiously busy kitchen. I then meet Sebastian one of the sous chefs and he's talking about his time traveling, cooking and finally ending up at Chiltern. He makes some suggestions and im on my way. For some reason there's a mix up and someone  approaches with a Bloody Mary. Ive been up way too long but im sure i didnt order it. But What the hell i said id take it anyways if it didnt belong to another ticket. I dont generally like them but realized after how excellent the first sip was that ive been drinking sub par ones for who knows how long. Score.
My food starts coming out and a couple of older dodded up ladies sit near me then start complaining about how they want a booth and were disappointed in that thats what they shouldve had. My server takes it graciously and says he'll talk to the reservationists. They are moved soon after. Thank goodness. Dont think i could have dealt with that. I have a chat with my server and he says the place has become somewhat of a hot spot and that people come to be seen and watch. As someone who's here for a Michelin starred chefs cooking, the best seats are at the pass! Soon a gentleman is sat next to me and we agree on the same topic. Turns out he's just as obsessive with food as i am and is a regular here. I recommend the carrot dessert which is unusual, complex and ultimately delicious. We are now food allies.
Aside from the carrot dessert, the beef and veggie hash and the dry aged burger and fries are fantastic, comforting and have their own delicious twist. Service was excellent and as someone who is not famous and was treated very well. I think having a rapport with the kitchen also helped greatly but when it's about the food, that's how you focus. I guess if youre a scene person, just dont act like those ladies...

review.author: Emily G.
review.description: My family of 7 ate here for dinner during our trip to London and enjoyed it a lot. The building itself and the garden are beautiful and quaint while also trendy. We had a perfect private dining room to block out some of the noise. Crab doughnuts and fried chicken snacks were very tasty, and everyone enjoyed their mains as well. Waitstaff was friendly and accommodating.

review.author: Aleksandra T.
review.description:
Unknowingly, i came to one of London's hottest restaurants. I could see why everyone really likes it. I did too! The staff is very nice, the atmosphere is very cool and intimate at the same time and the cocktails and food are great. 
Definitely try the gnocchi! I think, no i know, it was my favorite thing on the menu out of everything we tried.

review.author: Marc S.
review.description: So much attention to detail from start to finish. Perfect portions. Sea bass, roasted chicken and chocolate tart. Enjoy. Try the chefs counter and watch your meal prepared.

review.author: Jen C.
review.description: Went here for my birthday and had a marvelous time. The atmosphere was so fun and the service is absolutely top notch.  We started with the bacon cornbread and the crab doughnuts.  Both shouldn't be missed!  The rest of the dinner was fresh and flavorful.  Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a special night on the town! Can't wait to go back!

review.author: Michella L.
review.description: Booked a few weeks in advance to secure a table for weekend brunch. The decor inside is lovely but finding the actual restaurant once you've entered the premise is a bit of a maze. It could do with some signposting or a person guiding patrons through. Though we had a reservation at 2:00- we were told to wait for 25 mins.  When we were sat I promptly ordered the peach mint champagne spritzer. It didn't end up arriving until after the food which was crazy- also served in a highball glass which I felt the presentation could have been better. The food was flavoursome but portions are small for the price. I ordered the eggs florentine and my friend ordered the eggs Benedict. The eggs florentine was flavoursome but I can't attest to saying it was anything out of the ordinary. My friend and I shared a stack of the pancakes which we both enjoyed and we were glad we ordered as did not feel full from our egg dishes. Service was consistent and decor inside is lovely however I wouldn't rush to come back here- expensive and nothing out of the ordinary.

review.author: Sofia G.
review.description: Probably the best pancakes I've had in my life, and I don't say that lightly. Will say the service wasn't the friendliest, but it was overall a really cute place for weekend brunch!! Would definitely go back!!!

review.author: Alexandra M.
review.description:
Sooo expensive.  Not family friendly unless your children are extremely well behaved and keep a controlled volume.  
However, this place is amazing!  The decor is wonderful, a little odd but who cares when the food is fantastic.  It is extremely upscale and has a dress code.  Chiltern's food was incredible.  Small servings for the price but that's what you get at such a fancy, expensive, 5-star restaurant.  
Americans- please keep in mind that all restaurants in Europe are very different than what you are accustomed to.  Service is great but slow because meals, especially dinner, take much longer in Europe.  Relax and enjoy!

review.author: Keith O.
review.description:
Booking: Either the mass panic bookings of 2014 have passed, or I was one of the lucky ones that didn't seem to have a problem getting a table for Dinner at Chiltern Firehouse. Was offered a place at the Chef's Counter on the phone, which I took (and recommend you ask for!). 
Arrival: Staff were friendly and courteous, and we grabbed some champagne at the bar while our table was being readied. Apart from quite a few Russian oligarchs, the bar was wells stocked with 12, 18 and 25year Japanese whiskeys, and some decent champagne options.
Searing: We were originally sat at a normal table, but pushed correctly to be placed as booked at Chef Counter. CC is a little less formal, and requires sitting on a high stool with less leg room; so if you have a long leggy date (in a dress or otherwise) you may want to save it for next time. That said, it's the best table at the Firehouse; watching the speed and precision of the appetiser area, with the giant meat grill & smoking each behind, was a great conversation piece. The chef's ears perked up while we were chatting about what he was doing, and gave us a taste while explaining everything. The man was insanely busy, so that small gesture was truly special.
Food: 
+ Crab Donuts have a well earned reputation as a 'must have'. Only three of them but delicious.
+ Streak Tartare: a late summer sun sat on the tartare, that you beat into each other to give a very rich dish. The Firehouse hot sauce, a smoked spicy apple flavour, was insanely delicious. I would literally buy bottles of it alone. 
+ Calamari: now off the summer menu, it was still delicious, fresh and not even remotely rubbery.
+ Main: credit to the waiter, he recommended we share the day's special of 300g Wagu beef with a wasabi-yogurt sauce and rocket salad (possibly as it was also £78). We paired it up with the Maple-Bourbon Sweet Potatoes (which is a mash, not fries). All I can say is the beef was succulent and tender, perfectly medium-rare; but the sweet potatoes mash- my god. Nearly too sweet, but I was licking (secretly) the copper bowl it arrived it (which is straight from the hot plate, so watch out). More. I wanted more. 
+/- Dessert: Key lime pie was lovely. The hint of bitterness was exactly what was needed after the rich meal. My companion had re fudge cake; a classic, but didn't blow me away. Tastes differ I guess! 
+ Wine: Glass of Pecorino, my choice and the waiter's favourite (being Italian). 
+ Service: solid and attentive. Waiter recognised me from somewhere else and told me at then end of the night, which was nice, and didn't mind having a conversation that didn't make you feel he was being nice for the sake of tips. 
- Other: exit later in the evening is out the side entrance by the hotel, though a franky dull corridor near the hotel area, into the side street. Just... Why? Makes you feel you are being turfed out into the gutter. 
Secret suggestion: find the smoking area past the toilets with the lipstick all over it. Meet some celebs. There are other bits, but unless you are a master class blagger or engine celeb, g'luck :)

review.author: William S.
review.description: Love love love Chiltern Firehouse. One of the best meals I have in London. The snacks are uber yummy. Get the bacon cornbread, crab meat donuts and fried chicken. For main, the lamb, Iberico pork and short ribs are excellent. End the meal with chocolate ganache. Definitely coming back here when I'm back in town. Call ahead for reservations.

review.author: Louise F.
review.description: Best pancakes I have ever ate, hands down! I'm from Los Angeles and I love pancakes so I know pancakes :), and these were just perfect! I got a side of berries and it was the best breakfast a girl can ask for.

review.author: Hiran T.
review.description: It's a bit posh, but quite lovely actually. Famous with the famous, the Chiltern Firehouse is easier to get into by day and so Sunday brunch is a good option for those limited by either timeframe or budget, and those looking for a nice place to catch up what friends. Choose from either the indoor dining room or the flower-filled outdoor courtyard. Try the Bloody Mary and crab omlettes, eggs Benedict or steak tartare with homemade hot sauce. The service and is mildly intimidating and impeccable - but, hey, that's why you wanted to come.....

review.author: Carlo A.
review.description:
After reading about this as the "must-see" restaurant of the moment, I knew it had to be my one big night out of fine dining.  I was happy to get the reservation that I wanted, and pulling up to the restaurant in our taxi, it definitely felt like I had arrived at someplace special.  
The building is awesome, and the decor of the restaurant is fabulous.  We were shown to a great table, and everyone at the host stand seemed nice but a bit aloof -- to be expected, I guess.  However, our wait staff was amazing -- friendly, knowledgeable, and fun!  The food was terrific, though nothing I probably couldn't have had elsewhere, including San Francisco where I live.  The reason to come here is a combo of the food, the service, and the vibe and energy of the restaurant.  Make it a destination on your next London visit!

review.author: Fede D.
review.description: We went here for a brunch. Had the pancakes which come with jams and butter, nice and the right sweetness!! And the french toasts - good although not outstanding according to my husband. Nice decor and personnel is very friendly. On balance is a good spot for a week-end brunch. Reservation is highly recommended to avoid long lines. We will come back to try more dishes!

review.author: Nabil K.
review.description:
Nice restaurant. 
The decoration is very nice. 
The service is very fast and incredible. 
The food is more English than international.

review.author: James L.
review.description:
I confess that even though I read mixed reviews of Chiltern Firehouse and didn't really have high expectations of the food, I still wanted to go in the hope of meeting Kylie (Minogue) there.  Alas it was not to be and I left sans Kylie as a new bff (her loss obvs).
Firstly, the staff they hire are all gorgeous and friendly.  Our waiter had the most beautifully perfect set of teeth combined with a great French accent that we all couldn't help but gaze into his lovely smile.  And our Sommelier was just charming.  The wine she helped us choose was a perfect match to our food.
The food was a little disappointing.  I ordered the crab donuts, steak tartare, and Grilled Iberico Pork for mains.  Crab donuts were okay but surprisingly not very much crab.  Steak tartare was definitely the highlight as this was served with a deliciously spicy smoked sauce that made the raw beef sing.  Iberico pork was very disappointing.  While the pork itself was perfectly tender and tasty, the accompaniments were a green, sour, slushy mess and did nothing to enhance or compliment the pork.
For the price we paid, I wouldn't rush back in a hurry.

review.author: Bill E.
review.description:
Made a reservation about a month in advance with no problem.  Was looking forward to a great meal with family.  The decor is definitely interesting as it still houses the vestiges of its prior firehouse incarnation.  There was a young and hip vibe with the clientele and we looked forward to a relaxing dinner.   The waitstaff was attractive and efficient, but certainly not warm or inviting.  The food came quickly and looked beautiful, but it lacked deep flavor, and the fish was overcooked and dry.  We seemed to be in a high traffic area (somewhat near the bar) and while many waitstaff ran past our table, our waiter was quite scarce.  Water glasses were left unfilled, and wine was not poured as needed.  
Overall,  that Chiltern is quite consistent.  From the moment that you arrive you will enjoy the look of the venue, the beauty of the staff, and the presentation of the food.  At the same time, the venue, staff and food lack any real depth and all seem to be going through the motions.  There are too many good food choices in London to pay top dollar at Chiltern Firehouse, only to leave feeling like something important was missing.

address.streetAddress:
1 Chiltern Street
London W1U 7PA
United Kingdom

review.author: Ainslie F.
review.description:
This was in my top 3 meals of all time. We were on vacation visiting my brother who works in London and he recommended we go to Chiltern Firehouse for our Thanksgiving dinner.
We were extremely lucky to get a reservation through a friend and it was definitely worth the ask! That night they had a Thanksgiving themed menu with the best sweet potato mash I've ever had. But the crown jewel of the night was our sommelier who went above and beyond bringing us different wines to taste, and obviously we obliged and ordered the bottles because his recommendations were impeccable.
If you get a chance to dine here I promise you won't be disappointed! The service and ambience was very refreshing, especially since it's such a hyped scene.

review.author: Soumeya B.
review.description:
The menu at this place is one of the most "american" in London. It has a ton of healthy options, really good salads and fresh fish when I was there last week. I enjoyed the appetizers the most. The beef tartar was well done, with the right balance of flavors and the right cut. The key lime pie was out of this world and so innovative, it was a shell with a creamy filling and ton of flavor. 
I love the ambiance of this place and some of London's finest agree too. On my last visit, Zaha Hadid was there with a bunch of people.
The service was perfect.

review.author: Michelle H.
review.description:
I believe this was referred by my friend via goop. 
Great find for me in London, trendy spot for brunch.  We came here on the weekday where it wasn't crowded.  Between 2 ladies we shared the pancakes (fluffy and moist), crab scramble (good not great), and steamed white egg (yummy).  All were pretty small portions minus the pancakes, so I suggest sharing or getting more than one item to satisfy your cravings! 
Will be coming back, ciao!

review.author: Jean V.
review.description: Overpriced average food wrapped in a nice decor sprinkled with attitude. Awful service and manager. You always have to wait for a table even with a reservation (even a famous actor was screaming at them), service is not what you would expect for these prices. Never again.

review.author: David R.
review.description:
Wow - food, service, wine, ambiance, pretty people....
Great experience and one of the better culinary spots I've visited in Europe in recent years. Everything was spot on from the fried chicken snack, to the ravioli with truffles and fresh peas, to the grilled imberico. The polenta with buckwheat and truffles was one of the best things I've ever had. Service was over the top - very friendly and professional.
If you have the expense budget and you appreciate fine food this is a must visit in London...

review.author: Francesca T.
review.description: I've been wanting to come here for a while so I was really looking forward to the experience. I ordered an appetizer salad as an entre as I wasn't expecting many vegan options so that was fine. Our table ordered a few bottles of wine to share and we had a really great time. Chiltern is definitely more for the experience (the decor is beautiful and the staff are amazing) than for the food but most of my friends thoroughly enjoyed what they ordered as well. Glad I got to come once but I'm not sure if I would come back.

review.author: Lisa C.
review.description:
My friend managed to snag this booking months in advance- don't ask me how it's done! London's hottest restaurant is frequented by celebrities who hail from near and far. Unfortunately on a Monday night, none of them were in sight, but the paparazzi were camped outside the entrance nonetheless. Upon arrival, I was greeted by no less than 5 members of staff before I even reached the hostess, and I was shown to my table immediately to await my friends. 
They have a lovely cute drinks/snack menu for those who are waiting, and the starters on there are different than the proper starters you can later order with dinner. And the one thing that struck me is that Chiltern is surprisingly affordable- you can get a glass of wine for £5, a bottle of wine for under £25, starters for £15ish, desserts for under £10, and mains are in the £25-30 range generally. We ordered the crab-filled doughnuts as a snack and got the Grenache blanc for wine... I don't think you can go wrong with the wine list, it's just a matter of price, and the doughnuts came highly recommended and the innovation did not disappoint.  
As a starter, I ordered the grilled octopus (served with aubergine, daikon, and mushrooms) with a lovely miso sauce. One of my friends ordered the sea trout crudo, which was basically sashimi served with some sort of fish roe (I am not into that, but if that is your sort of thing, you'd probably like it). For my main, I got the spring lamb, served with black garlic, goat's curd, and grilled lettuce. The goat's curd was interesting... it was like a sour cream kind of taste and texture. Unfortunately one of my friends ordered the roasted turbot and she got food poisoning later in the night, and we think that is the reason why. And for the dessert, there is a frozen panna cotta that was positively divine... you definitely have to try it! I also had the tokaji dessert wine which was the perfect finish. 
Overall, it was a great experience, but I just had to mention the food poisoning but I hope the restaurant makes amends! Other than that, the venue is surprisingly normal and there is no need for normal people to be intimidated :)

review.author: Nima M.
review.description: Great atmosphere, great cocktails, great snacks, great presentation. Sumac Water melon was amazing.

review.author: Carolina V.
review.description: Great food in decent portions and in a really classy setting. Get the bacon cornbread and the crab doughnuts - they're a must! Amazing staff and wonderful eggs florentine too... Tourists eyeing our food and speaking loudly were a little less amazing.

review.author: Kenneth R.
review.description: Cannot say how disappointed we were last night. Our halibut came out cold, yet tasted like someone tried to finish it at the last minute with a butane torch. All other items were bland or over-sauced. While the room and scene were all superior, we cannot suggest anyone go here for the food. Just really poor.

review.author: E J.
review.description:
Currently, this is the place to be and be seen due to it's celebrity clientele - so jumping on the band wagon, we headed to Chiltern Firehouse for Sunday Brunch.   
While the decor is beautiful; plush booths, an incredible tiled bar where you can watch the food being made and everything you'd really expect from a restaurant with such a great reputation, I was a little disappointed.  
 The staff cannot be faulted for their manners and service, they're attentive and helpful but at times it felt like they were a little too attentive. We'd barely been sat down two minutes before they had rushed over to take our order, and the food was as quickly set onto the table in front of us.   
Honestly, I can't fault the food - it was well presented, well cooked and tasted lovely, however I wouldn't say it was any better than some other cheaper restaurants in London. When you're paying such a high price tag, you would expect something a little more mind blowing than what we were served. The champagne cocktails were probably the highlight of the meal, while the coffee was weak and a little tasteless.   
Would I recommend this place? Sure, if only for the experience of saying you've been and done a little celeb spotting while you were at it - but sadly I feel that's probably the best feature of the place.

review.author: Daniel F.
review.description:
To say it's hard to get a booking is an understatement. I had to wangle a reservation from someone in the know for me and my friends.
PROS:
- You might see a celeb.
- The bar waiting area is very nice.
- The starters. The Venison Sausage Rolls was flavoursome and tasty. The Crab doughnuts. Now these were raved upon by many upon research and they are OK.
- They have some lovely house wine (so much so we continued to drink another bottle after)
- We sat at a table but the area where the chefs cook you can sit at.
- The Garden as you enter. Sat outside after eating and enjoying over hearing conversations amongst the rich.
- It's situated in a lovely area of Marylebone. Right opposite one of my fav places to unwind (Monocle Cafe).
CONS:
- The tables all feel a bit too tightly compact to one another.
- It all feel a bit stiff. Maybe it feels like the place to be seen rather than a place to go eat well. And I really couldn't wait to dine at somewhere Nuno Mendes was head chef.
- The eggs Benedict. Biscuit instead of muffin. I really would prefer a posh English muffin than an American dry biscuit. Disappointed to say the least.
- The Lobster Scrambled Eggs. Was horrible in all honesty. One way of ruining an expensive ingredient with one of the most simple. Avoid.
The problem with places like this is that the 'buzz', 'hype' and 'reputation' sometimes proceeds itself. And for those prices and mark up it is not worth it in terms of value. Unless of course you saw David Beckham or some world star perhaps... ;)

review.author: Robbie B.
review.description: Despite the hype, food doesn't deliver the goods. Drinks were well made however. That said a table in the garden is nice to dine in.

review.author: Maria A.
review.description: Absolutely delicious meal. Worth the extra $. Atmosphere was great. Everything from drinks to dessert was perfectly flavored. Must go.

review.author: Derek P.
review.description:
Having been to CF for drinks I was really looking forward to eating there, and was not disappointed.  We were seated on the patio which is much nicer than the dining room which can feel a bit cramped.
Starters: the best oyster I have ever had in my life, crab donuts, bacon cornbread, and a watermelon goats cheese salad that were all delicious.
Mains: most of our group had the lobster noodles, I went with the pork.  You know that moment when everyone likes what they are eating so much they stop talking?  We had one of those.
Perfect weather and lots of rosé helped but it really was a great meal.

review.author: Stephen H.
review.description: So we very accidentally came to Chiltern because we had been told to go to Purl, across the street.  We already had reservations elsewhere and just wanted to pop in for a drink.  My date had noticed the cool lighting outside in the courtyard, and like moths, we were drawn in.  We managed to visit one of the coolest bars and have some of the best drinks we've had in London.  I didn't say this was the cheapest place, but you definitely get what you pay for.

review.author: Aubrie W.
review.description: We sat at the chefs counter and watched them cook! It was a great experience. All the waiters were very friendly and attentive and the food was wonderful. We got the rib eye, roasted cauliflower, bacon cornbread and watermelon ricotta salad. All was delicious but I absolutely loved the salad.

review.author: M R.
review.description: This place is beautiful and the food is delicious. The service is good, although a bit strange that all the servers look identical. It is very hard to get reservations but i have a little tip for my fellow yelpers....if you go early and sit in the bar you can grab someones no-show reservation. This worked 1 of 2 times i tried it. If you dont get in at least you can have a glass of prosecco, people watch and check out the beautiful space.

review.author: Katie M.
review.description: We recently went to Chiltern and it was awesome! The entire staff is incredibly nice, accommodating and tres chic (the hostess pantsuits are gorgeous!). We had the most amazing meal, each plate was better than the last, and they even gave us dessert, on the house, because we were celebrating our honeymoon. Everyone went out of their way to make us feel special. The sommelier paired the perfect wine with our meal and the bar tenders make a mean dirty martini (hard to come by in London, if you can believe it). The ambience was warm, inviting and very romantic! We will definitely be returning on our next trip to London.

review.author: Julie D.
review.description: Delicious and a great atmosphere! Had the Fire Drill cocktail that was so tasty. A few MUST HAVES: Starters and snacks - corn fritters, octopus and Jerusalem artichokes all amazing!! We had the Iberico pork and the cauliflower for mains that were both excellent. And then there was dessert.... milk and honey was SOOO GOOD as was the key lime pie. It took us 2 months to get a reservation at 18:00 on a Wednesday and by 20:00 they were definitely waiting to turn the table.  Definitely worth it.

address.streetAddress:
1 Chiltern Street
London W1U 7PA
United Kingdom

review.author: Ellie P.
review.description:
I am completely in love with this place, and so happy that Viajante's replacement is such a standout. Nuno has done it again. 
Yup, it's in a former firehouse. This new space is warm and sexy and has a sense of place -- similar to Viajante. Now that it's less of a trek to get to, it seems to be a magnet for famous people. But you should go here because it is great and lovely. The ceiling looks like it is covered with the burlap strap woven bottoms of the seats of antique chairs. 
Sit at the "chef's table" (the bar) and watch the action at a 10+ foot long stove, custom made by some company in America. Getting that shipped out must have been quite an undertaking.
The cocktail list is incredible. I was waiting for my dining companion and enjoyed what I believe was called "love in a cold place" -- all of my favorite things in a glass. 
I'd had the Iberico pork steak at one of the Portuguese nights at Viajante, and it was great here, too. 
Sadly no frozen olive oil candies, but they do give you some chocolates to finish the meal.
Gluten-free notes: Many (half or more) of the dishes on the menu are gluten-free. They know what gluten is and can help you out. Unfortunately no freshly baked cumin rolls like Viajante had.

review.author: Christina M.
review.description: What can I say? This place is on another level. I love that it was a former firehouse, adds so much character! It is a trendy hotspot with incredible service and sensational food. Hands down one of my favourite dining experiences.

review.author: Dorota K.
review.description: A friend couldn't make her dinner and gave us her booking and oh my goodness what a treat that was! The service was impeccable, the atmosphere was great and the food divine... Highly recommended

review.author: Penny S.
review.description:
Very classy English style. Atmosphere and service splendid. Food also very tasty.
Out of the 4 dishes we ordered, only the rib is not very tasty, all others are awesome.

review.author: E B.
review.description: Everything about this restaurant exceeded expectations.  I was afraid it would be a tad over hyped and it wasn't.  We ate at the chef's counter because we were not able to get a reservation for a regular table and I am glad we had this experience which allowed us to watch the chefs in action.  The atmosphere is great and the service is impeccable, friendly, and unpretentious.  The food was outstanding as well.  The zucchini starter, the crab donuts, the caesar salad, the pumpkin gnocchi, and the chicken were all delicious.  These are very talented chefs, serving quality food with very fresh ingredients in an unpretentious setting.  We even purchased the cookbook and attempted to make a reservation for the next evening (unfortunately they were booked solid, but I can see why)  This isn't one of those places that makes it difficult to get a reservation to appear desirable... the food is that good and the reservation dept will do their best to accommodate you.  Next time our travels take us to London I am making sure to make at least one reservation at this restaurant.  I live in New York City and I have never had service this welcoming and accommodating at any restaurant.  When we were leaving they called a cab for us and held an umbrella over my fiance as we walked out of the building.  These small gestures all helped make a great experience.

review.author: Kelly H.
review.description: It was our second last night in London and we were looking for chic London cuisine-Both Foursquare and Yelp pointed us towards The Chilton Firehouse.  After zigzagging through the streets for quite a while we finally found it.  Speaking to the Maitre d' we were lucky enough to secure two seats at the chef's table. We were greeted very warmly by Rafal who would be our server for the evening.  We started out with a wonderful full bodied Italian red. The first course chosen was the crab stuffed donuts which proved to be light and delicious.  The second course chosen was the pumpkin porridge-truly fantastic with hazelnuts and chestnuts on top.  Perfect balance! Growing up eating wild game my father hunted I was thrilled to find venison on the menu which was enthusiastically encouraged by Rafal. It was such a pleasure to watch the hustle of the kitchen as everyone worked fluidly to create some exquisite looking plates-every dish was tended to like a work of art! The venison(ordered medium rare) did not disappoint! Smoky, juicy and balanced out with a pecan pesto and a teriyaki-glazed chard. Every bite was beyond delectable! After asking us a few questions, Rafal suggested the frozen apple pannacotta for dessert and it couldn't have been more perfect! Rafal's charm and wit made our experience incredibly enjoyable. As the meal came to a close Rafal brought a picture perfect cappuccino that tasted as perfect as it looked. Shifting to the bar for a nice after dinner drink-a special Zacapa rum was chosen. The bartenders were equally wonderful, charming and a joy to watch as they mixed endless cocktails with precision and ease. Our experience will be talked about for a very long time! THANK YOU!

review.author: Chris G.
review.description: This was one of the best meals I have had in recent memory. The atmosphere is fantastic, the crowd of beautiful people is nice, the service is warm and excellent... But to top all that off with this menu and the mind blowing execution of our orders? Just wow. This is a new place and I am sure the magic can't last. Does it ever? But cheers to one of the best recent restaurant experiences I've had not only in London, but in my two home towns New York and Los Angeles as well.

review.author: Tiana B.
review.description: This review is for the lounge - just lovely. My favourite place to dance into the early hours.

review.author: Alan E.
review.description: The Chiltern Firehouse is possibly my favorite restaurant and club in all of London. The interior is warm and provides various nooks for private conversations. The entire building and patio are meticulously maintained.

review.author: F S.
review.description: Went for dinner on Saturday night. Atmosphere was lovely. I'd go again just for that. Service was also good and very friendly. They told us we had to be finished in 2 1/2 hours which was a pity because we would have stayed on and had desert and more drinks. I'm not a fan of restaurants that move you out, especially if you're spending big as we were. Cocktails were very nice. Starters of crab donuts and octopus were excellent but main courses were just ok. Maple sweet potato mash was the consistency of baby food and far too sweet. Could only taste maple. Sadly, all the food was totally over salted. The whole table said so. Apart from the crab donuts (which were gorgeous), octopus and maple mash everything, without exception was salty and this is coming from people who love highly-seasoned food. Still, service and atmos was good enough that we'll be back. Also, it's a shame they save the pretty courtyard as a "sacred space" for hotel guests. It remained more or less completely empty whereas we could have been continuing our evening and spending money!

review.author: Suzecool C.
review.description: Very discreet from the street; inside extremely classy and elegant. I adored the hallways and bar area was simply beautiful. I had booked a table for my daughter & myself, the staff were wonderfully accommodating with her, fixing posh juices, shaking her hand giving her a super cute little dessert! Our waiter from Spain (Pierre?) was a stand out as was the bar tender in the main bar area. Would have given 5* alas there was no soup on the menu, which on a freezing day - we were craving!!

review.author: Richard K.
review.description: Really good food. Nice range of dishes from the quite simple to the complex... There is also a good price range to cater for people on different budgets. The staff were also very polite and knowledgeable.

review.author: Caren H.
review.description:
If you follow any celeb press you will know this is THE place to be in London.  Not sure why it has such a following and not sure why the paparazzi didn't photograph me, but oh well.
The place is very pretty and if you can get near the seats by the kitchen that looks to be fun.  The space is very pretty although lacks soul and the women all walk around in these monochrome brightly colored jumpsuits that look like they are from Star Trek.  Bizarre.
For those that had been to Viajante, expect something very different--whereas Viajante was very creative, experimental and playful--this is much more subtle, orchestrated and refined.  Crab donuts, octopus appetizer, the pork and fish dishes were all very good.  No complaints.  But I wasn't wowed over either.
With all the celeb buzz good luck getting in, but sit back and enjoy if you do.

review.author: Sara N.
review.description: This place is spectacular! I love that they converted this place into a restaurant-super cool. Sadly, they were too packed to seat us for dinner, but we sat by the bar for cocktails and light appetizers. The cocktails were delightful! The apps were very nice too. Next time I am here I will definitely try dinner too!

review.author: Mari I.
review.description:
Loved the ambiance and trendy feeling
Got a 9,30pm thru a VIP friend and had a good time. We loved the trendy and casual chic ambiance and the food was pretty good too. We only ordered a bunch of small plates and the bacon maple cornbread was the best! Also the chicken bites and the gnocchi. The famous crab doughnuts were nothing special though, Quite bland actually! But above all I liked getting to know what all the hype was about --and it was fun.
Visited October 2015

review.author: Antony A.
review.description: London's current hotspot that shows no sign of slowing down anytime soon. Great scene, amazing bartenders and phenomenal cocktails. Makes for a lively (and highly amusing evening out)

review.author: Chloe L.
review.description: We had the snug room, the food was amazing , the staff are excellent and the drink menu and wine list is brilliant .

review.author: Akiko O.
review.description: It's a fun place to visit.  We celebrated my partner's sister's BD there, and we had a fantastic time.  Food was not so memorable, but drink was incredible.  After we enjoyed champaign by the glass, our sommelier did a great job recommending a beautiful bottle of Burgundy Pinot Noir.  Dessert wine was also great.  Service was excellent.  Servers were amazingly attentive for such a packed restaurant.  I will be happy to go back.

review.author: Kasper M.
review.description: Amazing place - old fire-house converted to restaurant. Great ambiance, amazing service and the most wonderful brunch. Not the cheapest but definitely worth every penny

review.author: Alice C.
review.description: Great service, amazing atmosphere and very creative dishes. I ordered almost everything on the menu, loved the appetizers, entrees (main) was good; but I recommend just ordering a whole bunch of appetizers and maybe one main. Our waiter was super friendly, even took us on a tour around the kitchen. PS go check out the secret hidden smoking area. Pretty bad a$$!

address.streetAddress:
1 Chiltern Street
London W1U 7PA
United Kingdom

review.author: S L.
review.description: Came here for birthday drinks with one of my best friends. The decor of the horseshoe shaped bar is beautiful. Even though our servers took ages to bring our drinks, they were so sweet, I couldn't get upset (and I could because it was my birthday). Also there was a bulldog and puppy circling around and guests were surprisingly sweet and responsive towards the adorable animals. All in all, great experience.

review.author: Tinkerbell q.
review.description: This review is for the hotel. Seriously, impeccable service. They somehow know your name from the second you arrive and go out of their way to make you feel taken care of. Oh, and the bedrooms have fireplaces.

review.author: Beth P.
review.description: Wow! Beautiful place, food, people, ambiance, service!  One of the best restaurants I've ever been to hands down. Our server, Joanna was fabulous. Great recommendations, very knowledgable about menu items. We started with cornbread made with bacon grease served with a chipotle butter. Also has two bottles of excellent New Zealand sauvegnon blanc. Our appetizers were grilled octopus, oysters and burrata cheese. Everything was amazing. The seasonings really come out in the flavor, unbelievable. For entrees, I had the monkfish, daughter had halibut and husband and other daughter had the pork. All dishes were works of art and simply incredible. Our desserts also were to die for. We shared a key lime pie, a chocolate fish and a mandarin sorbet. We got a tour of hotel and rooms after dinner which was lovely. Great bar and intimate feel, highly recommend this place!

review.author: Laura H.
review.description: Very lovely restaurant with a classy and well mannered crowd. Food modern and delicious and not as outrageously expensive as you would imagine. Entire feel of the place reminded me of an upmarket Californian restaurant.Particularly stunning gardens and entryway. Not quite as exclusive as it was last year so a little easier to book a reservation and can often stroll up just to use the restaurant's bar.

review.author: Tolga E.
review.description: First things first. Everyone has a beard here. The doorman. The waiter. Chefs. The other wAiter. And not your designer stubble either. These are PROPER beards. This is a very style conscious place. But regardless, the food was great. Best bits though were the sides, the starters and the desserts. The latter were especially creative not least the key lime pie and the apple panaccota. As for the sides, try the fried chicken and crab doughnuts. The mains were solid but nothing out of the ordinary. The exception was the fillet steak, wonderful smoky flavour and so tender.

review.author: James R.
review.description:
All that glitters is not gold. The disparity between the hype and the reality of the Chiltern firehouse was so extreme it needed calling out.
This is a beautiful location and it's buzzing, but once inside it felt like you were part of a machine designed to get you in and out, and onto the next guest.
Above all, it was the lack of consistency in terms of food and service that was astounding.
Too fast to take orders & way too slow to deliver them. Food was brought to the table out of sequence. Insipid cocktails, staff with a lack of basic knowledge on the drinks / food offering. The signature dish, 'Pork Iberico', was tough & dry and, worst of all, the 'maple sweet potato' side dish was so sweet it was inedible.
The whole operation appeared almost random, apparently lacking an authoritative maitre d' to ensure it flowed professionally.
There were several highlights, including some of the food dishes (Carrot blunts, Short rib, Octopus), but way too few to warrant the price and the reputation, especially when London has so many other great restaurants.
The one saving grace was our main server, who was excellent -  she was the only redemption for a venue that has built a reputation for being coolest eatery in town, yet completely lacked the attention to detail to deserve that accolade.

review.author: Leah S.
review.description: Fun and charming place with great food. A fun night out in London if you like  a casual place, great food and a good wine list.

review.author: Beth s.
review.description: Thank you so much for making my husband's 50th Birthday even more special!  I wanted to thank everyone at Chiltern Firehouse for the fabulous meal and experience while we were in London.  I especially want to thank the bartender who crafted a beautiful handmade cocktail especially for my husband and delivered it to our table with a message from our sons who could not be with us.  The restaurant and bar were packed, so I truly appreciate his efforts and my husband was blown away by the whole thing. Again, thank you for the lovely atmosphere, the outstanding food, the interesting crowd and a very special thank you to the bartender!!!!

review.author: Florence H.
review.description:
Sad to say that the hype may have gotten the best of this restaurant.
The small bites, appetizers and desserts were all fantastic. Well prepared and presented. The main courses we ok, but nothing spectacular. No real complaints, just nothing to write home about. While the restaurant has an excellent wine list, it is grotesquely overpriced. It's aimed towards those who want to be seen spending money, not those interested in drinking a great wine.
Our main waiter was very friendly. However, there seems to be overall poor communication between the staff. We would ask for a drink or bread and the message never seemed to be passed on - disappointing for a restaurant of this calibre. Having to re-ask for things multiple times is tiresome. The sommelier also left something to be desire as far as friendliness goes.
The atmosphere and décor are lovely and comfortable. Modern European with an open kitchen.
If you're prepared for the fact that it's over-hyped, you'll have a good dinner.

review.author: Annie S.
review.description: I loved my experience at Chiltern Firehouse. Although it was very difficult to get a reservation it was worth it. The caesar salad was excellent. My fish dish was flakey and moist inside and crisp on the outside. The service was perfect and I will make a reservation long before I travel to London to go back again!

review.author: s p.
review.description: Best Eggs Benedict I have ever had. There was a little snobbiness when I asked for a side of potatoes but I quickly got over it as the food was delicious and we were able to get it without a reservation. Yum. Ambience was fabulous too!

review.author: Rahul K.
review.description:
The decor is super and our waiter was fabulous, however, when the starter came wrong and we complained the manger Jonathan arrived who had the wrong attitude. He was more keen to prove us wrong than correct the mistake. We booked a table for 5, a few weeks ago but were given a table for 4 with a seat in the passage for the 5th. Don't be excited to visit as they overbook and have arrogance.
I think once the popularity wears out this place will be a disaster as needs to pay attention to the customer.

review.author: Eric R.
review.description:
The most pretentious place I have ever eaten at. You can read all the other reviews about the decor and the setting which is quite spectacular. The place is a scene to be seen and for those to see you. From the moment you arrive you are greeted by the outside bellman/bouncers? and looked up and down before you are delivered off to another chap who walks you thorough the maze to the hostess. 
Picture this, we went for breakfast on a Monday morning with four people and there was only a handful of tables occupied with about 25 staff people milling around trying to look busy. It was amazing the number of staff present for Monday morning breakfast.
We place our order for breakfast, with only one request, that one of the egg dishes be cooked well done. (no running yokes) Simple enough for any breakfast cook.
When the dish arrived, the yoke was still runny and we asked if we could get the order done as requested. The look and attitude that we received from the waitress was " I told them to cook it the way you wanted". It went back to the kitchen and was recooked.
Then I took a bite of my french toast, it was totally raw inside, with the milk and egg oozing out. I asked another waitress if the chef could finish cooking the french toast and she brought the dish back to the kitchen.
About 5 minutes later our waitress delivered us the following message from the Chef. " I will be happy to cook you another french toast, but it will come out the same way as before" OMG Any five year old can cook french toast!  I was ready to get up and go in the kitchen and show the chef how to make the simplest of breakfast foods.
It just wasn't worth the effort. 
I guess the celebs like their food un cooked. This place is not worth the time nor the effort, especially when there is such a big disconnect between the kitchen, staff and guest.
They obviously did not recognize who we were......
but I hope for all you reading this, you don't support such an unwelcoming place that can't train its staff and kitchen about basic customer service, considering they have so many people on duty.

review.author: Yvonne D.
review.description: A place you come just to be seen.  I was seen and I saw.  The food which was dinner was good.  I love snobby atmospheres, and we got into the lounge after which was fun. Dinner was nothing to write home about but then again I don't write much.

review.author: Justin G.
review.description: If I have to be honest, I have traveled extensively and you certainly get the feeling here that if your not a famous face your not worth much. We had a meeting in the less that par conference room and we're constantly harassed by the staff after hours as to wether or not we were staying at the hotel or not. For the over all price I do not see the value

review.author: Ks A.
review.description:
This place is the worst.  The crowd is old and wannabe.  Not contemporary or for the young, successful,  and attractive at ALL. The people there did not look good.
   This place claims to be elite but probably was 2 years ago.  We had dinner there and the food was tasteless and very average.  On top of that, they said we could get to the main bar area, and after having us spend so much money on crappy food, they did not let us in to the main bar, claiming they were at "full capacity".  Then when trying to leave, they tried to be "gracious" by hailing us a taxi out of a strange back ally.  The taxi, we realized while already on the road, was cash only, and took us on a completely round about route, which cost twice as much as any taxi we had taken for the same distance.  When we confronted the taxi driver, threatening to report him,  he gave us a discount.  
    All and all, we had a terrible and expensive experience being ripped off at the Chiltern Firehouse.  Don't believe the hype. Just don't go here.

review.author: Samanta S.
review.description: Had an amazing dinner saturday night at Chiltern. The full review is on my blog with loads of pictures. Usually the hottest places don't deliver on either food or service, here they deliver on everything. The food was creative and fun, the service was happy and it was as buzzy as it gets.

review.author: Joshua V.
review.description: Excellent food. Great service but rushed a little at first. Interesting desserts. Sort of loud but in a good environment. Chocolate ice cream was strong but good. We had  very positive experience. A great way to end our London trip.

review.author: v p.
review.description: I loved the decor and food but no where in all my travels, and there have been many, did a waiter as us to hurry it along.  Mind you, this is an expensive lunch, we certainly didn't linger long.  I guess his huff when we didn't order the moment he set the wine down should have been a clue.
